content.p: The International Multilateral Partnership Against Cyber Threats (IMPACT) Internship Description: The International Multilateral Partnership Against Cyber Threats (IMPACT) is the cyber security executing arm of the United Nations' specialised agency - the International Telecommunication Union (ITU). As the world’s first UN-backed comprehensive alliance against cyber threats, IMPACT brings together governments, academia and industry experts to enhance the global community’s capabilities in dealing with cyber threats. IMPACT provides ITU’s 193 Member States access to expertise, facilities and resources to effectively address cyber threats, as well as assisting United Nations agencies in protecting their ICT infrastructures. As an intern you will work within the Centre for Policy and International Cooperation and will be expected to assist with a variety of activities, including research, analysis, marketing, and communications. Interns will also assist in general office support and on-going projects. What can you gain? telephone: +6 (03) 8924 8000 fax: +6 (03) 8924 8001
